intro: Pseudocyclosorus submarginalis, commonly known as the narrow-margin water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four parts, forming a cross-shaped outline. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its reproductive structures include small, yellowish sori that are located on the underside of the leaves. Pseudocyclosorus submarginalis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
